originalTitle: 'Affront to humanity': Sudan slams Uganda for hosting RSF paramilitary boss
title: Big News: Sudan is Upset with Uganda!
content:
Hello, My Amazing Friends!

Hi everyone! It's your kid-friendly news reporter here, bringing you big news from our wonderful continent of Africa! Today, we are going to talk about something happening between two countries we know: Sudan and Uganda. It's a bit like when friends have a disagreement, but much bigger because it's about whole countries!

A Big Problem in Sudan

In a country called Sudan, there has been some fighting. This fighting is very sad because it makes many people scared. Children cannot always go to school, and families sometimes have to leave their homes to be safe. Everyone wants peace, where no one fights and everyone can play and learn happily.

Who is the RSF Group?

There is a group in Sudan called the Rapid Support Forces, or RSF for short. This group has a leader, a man named Mohamed Hamdan Dagalo. The RSF group is one of the groups that has been fighting in Sudan. The fighting has made life very hard for many children and grown-ups.

Uganda Met the RSF Leader!

Now, here is the news! Another country, Uganda, invited the RSF leader, Mr. Dagalo, to visit. He came to Uganda and met with important people there. This meeting made Sudan very, very unhappy and upset.

Why Sudan is Very Upset

Sudan says that by meeting the RSF leader, Uganda is not following important rules. Imagine if two friends were having a disagreement, and another friend went and played only with one side, especially the side that was causing trouble. The other friend might feel hurt or think their friend is not helping them. Sudan feels a bit like this. They feel like Uganda is not being a good friend to them, especially when there is fighting in Sudan. Sudan thinks Uganda should not be friendly with a group that is fighting their country. They believe it makes the problem worse, not better.

Did You Know?

Sudan is a very big country in Africa! Its capital city is Khartoum, which is where two big rivers, the White Nile and the Blue Nile, meet! Imagine two rivers giving each other a big hug!

Rules for Countries, Just Like Rules for Games!

When we play games, we have rules, right? Rules help everyone play fair and have fun. Countries also have rules about how they should act with each other. These are called "international rules." These rules help countries be good neighbours and try to stop fighting. Sudan feels that Uganda broke these important rules by meeting with the RSF leader. They say it's like not playing fair when a country is going through a very tough time. Countries should try to help each other find peace.

Why is Peace So Important?

Peace means no fighting, no sadness, and lots of happiness! When there is peace, children can go to school every day. They can play outside safely with their friends. Doctors can help sick people without being scared. Families can stay together in their homes and feel safe. Peace is a special gift that helps everyone grow, learn, and be happy. It means kids can dream big dreams for their future without worrying about war.

What Does Sudan Want?

Sudan wants the fighting to stop in their country. They want peace for all their people, especially the children. They also want other countries, like Uganda, to help them achieve peace, not to do things that might make the fighting seem okay or make it harder to stop. They want all countries to be friends and help each other in good ways, always working towards a world where everyone is safe and happy. Sudan hopes that leaders will always choose peace over fighting.

Did You Know?

Uganda is a beautiful country! It is sometimes called the "Pearl of Africa." It has amazing animals like gorillas and big elephants! Its capital city is Kampala, a busy and friendly place.

Being a Good Neighbour

Just like you try to be a good neighbour to the people next door, countries try to be good neighbours too. Being a good neighbour means you help each other, you don't do things that hurt others, and you always try to find peaceful ways to solve problems. Sudan believes Uganda was not being a good neighbour by meeting the RSF leader. They feel it might make the fighting last longer instead of helping it to stop. Good neighbours help each other in times of trouble.

Helping Children Everywhere

This news might sound big and grown-up, but it's important for children too. When there's fighting, children suffer the most. They lose their homes, their schools, and sometimes their families or friends. That's why we always hope for peace. Every child deserves to live in a safe and happy place where they can learn, play, and grow up strong. News like this reminds us how important it is for countries to work together for peace for all kids.

Hopes for the Future

Even though Sudan is upset, we always hope for a good future. We hope that Sudan and Uganda can talk and understand each other better. We hope that the fighting in Sudan stops very soon, and everyone can go back to their homes. And we hope that all children in Africa and all over the world can live in peace, where they can laugh, learn, and play every single day. Let's all wish for peace!

Did You Know?

The United Nations is a big group of almost all the countries in the world! They work together to try and keep peace and help people everywhere, especially children. They try to make sure everyone follows the "international rules" too!
summary: Sudan is very unhappy because Uganda met with the leader of the RSF, a group fighting in Sudan, which Sudan feels breaks important international rules for how countries should act.
whyMatters: This is important because when countries disagree or do things that upset others, it can make it harder to stop fighting, especially when many children are affected and need peace to live safely and happily.
